H0.text: In London in 1788, the ‘Daily Universal Register’ was relaunched as which newspaper. The Daily Telegraph

H1.text: In London in 1788, the ‘Daily Universal Register’ was relaunched as which newspaper. The Guardian

H2.text: In London in 1788, the ‘Daily Universal Register’ was relaunched as which newspaper. The Observer

H3.text: In London in 1788, the ‘Daily Universal Register’ was relaunched as which newspaper. Times2

A4.text: adopting its modern name on 1 January 1788.

A5.text: The Times was founded by publisher John Walter (1738–1812) on 1 January 1785 as The Daily Universal Register, with Walter in the role of editor.

A6.text: The Times was the first newspaper to bear that name, inspiring numerous other papers around the world.

A7.text: Archive from 1785 to 2008 – full text and original layout, searchable

A8.text: Times (London, England) Collection at the Harry Ransom Center
